title: Bake Off fans stunned by Paul Hollywood's 'brutal' final comment to tearful Steph

Bake Off fans were left stunned tonight as Paul Hollywood made one final brutal comment to a very tearful Steph Blackwell.

Steph was devastated this evening as a number of things went very wrong during the final, from her flop of a souffle to her disastrous showstopper.

Bookies' favourite Steph, a shop assistant who'd won Star Baker four times, was up against David Atherton and Alice Fevronia in a bid to win the trophy.

However Steph was left in tears after mucking up her illusion picnic basket using only cake, sweet bread and biscuits.

(Image: C4)

(Image: C4)

After walking back to her bench, Paul went over to hug her and said: "Never mind Steph."

And fans were left wincing over his comment.

One tweeted: "'Never mind Steph" is the most brutally upsetting thing any human could have possibly said in that moment #gbbo #GBBOFinal."

Another commented: "#GBBOFinal She knows, Pru knows, Paul knows. Steph's f***ed it #GBBO."

A third remarked: "Paul literally went innnnn on Steph! So nasty. No need. #GBBO #GBBOFinal."

But another commented: "Paul comforting Steph is one of the sweetest things. I feel for her so much #gbbo #GBBOFinal."

Tonight, self-confessed “underdog” David won Bake Off – despite not being named as Star Baker once during the series.

(Image: Channel 4)

(Image: Channel 4)

After lifting the trophy, David admitted it was a huge shock. “Honestly it was never in my mind that I thought I could win this.

“It feels so good! It’s been weeks and weeks of intensity and fatigue and then to finish it with this - I saved the best til last, and it’s the best feeling in the world. Week on week other people were stronger, I was always the underdog and yet I just managed to get through.

“All of it is a bit surreal, and I am still trying to process it, but the whole Bake Off journey is non-stop and part of it is just having the stamina.”
